post.author: gerardo
post.title: Sunfish Capsize in a 15MPH Wind
post.content:
This is my first time to sail alone and without the comfort of the Race Committee boat in a 15MPH wind. After about  my 6th time rounding the windward mark, I tried improving my tack. I was paying too much attention to how close I was to the mark and neglected other things.

I capsized once and I thought I'd better go in after this fearing that I might exhaust myself further should I capsize again while the wind gets heavier.

Looking back at a race last month, I was still confident after about  12 capsizes when the wind was at about  20MPH. And when the wind got to about  25MPH, I could not right my Sunfish on the last capsize. I was completely exhausted when the wind was at its peak. Sadly, the Race Committee boat had to pull my turtled Sunfish.
